dt: {bc}completely or almost completely depleted of resources or contents

dt.t: … crops are grown in the resulting field for a year or a few years until the soil is {wi}exhausted{/wi}, and then the field is abandoned …
I mean I was just {wi}exhausted{/wi}, totally {wi}exhausted{/wi}. I could barely walk up a flight of stairs without panting and wheezing.

shortdef: completely or almost completely depleted of resources or contents

dt: {bc}to deprive of a valuable quality or constituent
{bc}to draw off or let out completely
{bc}to empty by drawing off the contents
{bc}to consider or discuss (a subject) thoroughly or completely
{bc}to try out the whole number of

pt: {sc}deplete{/sc} {sc}drain{/sc} {sc}exhaust{/sc} {sc}impoverish{/sc} {sc}bankrupt{/sc} mean to deprive of something essential to existence or potency. {sc}deplete{/sc} implies a reduction in number or quantity so as to endanger the ability to function.
{sc}drain{/sc} implies a gradual withdrawal and ultimate deprivation of what is necessary to an existence.

pt.t: personal tragedy had {it}drained{/it} him of all spirit

pt: {sc}impoverish{/sc} suggests a deprivation of something essential to richness or productiveness.
{sc}bankrupt{/sc} suggests impoverishment to the point of imminent collapse.

pt.t: war had {it}bankrupted{/it} the nation of resources

pt: {sc}tire{/sc} {sc}weary{/sc} {sc}fatigue{/sc} {sc}exhaust{/sc} {sc}jade{/sc} mean to make or become unable or unwilling to continue. {sc}tire{/sc} implies a draining of one's strength or patience.
{sc}weary{/sc} stresses tiring until one is unable to endure more of the same thing.
{sc}fatigue{/sc} suggests great lassitude from excessive strain or undue effort.
{sc}exhaust{/sc} implies complete draining of strength by hard exertion.
{sc}jade{/sc} suggests the loss of all freshness and eagerness.

et: Latin {it}exhaustus{/it}, past participle of {it}exhaurire{/it}, from {it}ex-{/it} + {it}haurire{/it} to draw; akin to Middle High German {it}œsen{/it} to empty, Greek {it}auein{/it} to take
shortdef: to deprive of a valuable quality or constituent
